obsolete_code/

kahuna _before_non-comment_removal.pro

includes main-level program

NAME: KAHUNA

PURPOSE: Finds the center of 3 suns in a single image. Currently limited to a .bmp test image. Instead of scanning rows to crop, scans in a circle. Using solar centers, identifies fiducial positions.

Author information

Author

JEREN SUZUKI:

Space Sciences Laboratory 7 Gauss Way Berkeley, CA 94720 USA E-mail: jsuzuki@ssl.berkeley.edu

Routines

makelimbstrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, region=integer [, time=time]

Makes limb strips from full-length strips

result = quickmask(input_image, thresh)

Finds center of mask where pixels are above a given threshold

result = whichcropmethod(region)

Crops differently according to which region is selected.

makestrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, region=integer [, time=time]

Only saves 5 strips centered around the solar diameter to reduce the amount of limb- darkened pixels and to make the polynomial-fitted limbs more-or-less look similar.

circscancrop, mainxpos, mainypos, image, thresh, xpos, ypos, xoffset, yoffset, region=integer [, time=time]

Quickly finds the center of the main sun, scans in a circle, and locates the two secondary suns' centers.

limbfit, thresh, xpos, ypos [, plot=plot], region=integer [, time=time]

Uses the data from makelimbstrips and fits an n-th order polynomial to the limb to find where it crosses the threshold.

getstruct, struct [, time=time]

Finds the centers of a triple-sun image and loads all relevant information including offsets and angles into a new structure.

Routine details

top source makelimbstrips

makelimbstrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, region=integer [, time=time]

Makes limb strips from full-length strips

Parameters

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used to select pixels

xstrips out required type=structure

Structure containing row strips

ystrips out required type=structure

Structure containing column strips

Keywords

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Prints the elapsed time

top source quickmask

result = quickmask(input_image, thresh)

Finds center of mask where pixels are above a given threshold

Parameters

input_image in required type=byte

2D array of pixels to mask with threshold

thresh in required type=float

Threshold used to select pixels

top source whichcropmethod

result = whichcropmethod(region)

Crops differently according to which region is selected.

Parameters

region in required type=integer

1) main sun 2) 50% brightness sun 3) 25% brightness sun

top source makestrips

makestrips, thresh, xstrips, ystrips, region=integer [, time=time]

Only saves 5 strips centered around the solar diameter to reduce the amount of limb- darkened pixels and to make the polynomial-fitted limbs more-or-less look similar.

Parameters

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used to select pixels

xstrips out required type=structure

Structure containing row strips

ystrips out required type=structure

Structure containing column strips

Keywords

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Prints elapsed time

top source circscancrop

circscancrop, mainxpos, mainypos, image, thresh, xpos, ypos, xoffset, yoffset, region=integer [, time=time]

Quickly finds the center of the main sun, scans in a circle, and locates the two secondary suns' centers. Crops either of the secondary suns based on what region specified.

Parameters

mainxpos in required

X position of 100% brightness sun to scan in a circle around

mainypos in required

Y position of 100% brightness sun to scan in a circle around

image out required

Cropped area

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used in finding center

xpos out required type=float

Computed X position of center

ypos out required type=float

Computed Y position of center

xoffset out required

X offset of cropped region's bottom left corner

yoffset out required

Y offset of cropped region's bottom left corner

Keywords

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Print the elapsed time

top source limbfit

limbfit, thresh, xpos, ypos [, plot=plot], region=integer [, time=time]

Uses the data from makelimbstrips and fits an n-th order polynomial to the limb to find where it crosses the threshold.

Parameters

thresh out required type=float

Threshold used to select pixels

xpos out required type=float

X center

ypos out required type=float

Y center

Keywords

plot in optional

Makes some nice plots

region in required type=integer default=1

Which sun out of the three to find the center of. Defaults to the brightest sun

time in optional

Prints the elapsed time

top source getstruct

getstruct, struct [, time=time]

Finds the centers of a triple-sun image and loads all relevant information including offsets and angles into a new structure.

Parameters

struct out required type=structure

Structure containing the centers and cropped images of all 3 suns

Keywords

time in optional

Outputs how much time the program takes
